item.title: Slip Robotics snags $28M for its bots that can load a truck in five minutes
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description:
Drop by any given loading dock and a buzz of forklifts — loaded up with goods — can be spotted maneuvering in and out of truck trailers. This logistical dance can take up to an hour to fill a trailer, leaving truck drivers in idle limbo. The founders of Atlanta-based Slip Robotics say they’ve developed […]

item.title: SoundCloud introduces a cheaper plan for artists
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Music streaming platform SoundCloud announced Tuesday that it is introducing a new, cheaper paid plan for artists simply called Artist, while renaming its Next Pro plan to Artist Pro. The new basic tier will cost $39 per year and put some limits on features like track amplification, distribution, monetization, and AI mastering. Artists subscribing to […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: FTC bans hidden junk fees in short-term lodging, live-event ticket prices
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
The U.S. Federal Trade Commission passed a rule on Tuesday banning hidden “junk fees” for live events, hotels, and vacation rentals. The agency says the new rule prohibits “bait-and-switch pricing,” and other practices that hide total prices and bury junk fees in the live-event ticketing and short-term lodging industries, noting that these “unfair and deceptive” […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Shein must cede Indians’ data, control of local ops to re-enter India
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Shein must surrender all data of Indian customers and control of its local operations to its partner, Reliance Retail, and keep operations fully local to re-enter the Indian market, according to new government disclosures that reveal how the apparel and accessories retailer secured a rare exception to India’s ban on Chinese-linked apps. In a parliamentary […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Databricks raises $10B as it barrels toward an IPO
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Databricks, the data analytics platform, has raised $10 billion in a funding round that values the company at $62 billion (up from $43 billion). Backers include Thrive Capital, Andreessen Horowitz, DST Global, GIC, and Iconiq Growth. The round is one of the largest venture rounds in history, and will drive future future mergers and acquisitions, […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Popular LatAm digital payment service AstroPay launches multi-currency wallet
item.dc:creator: Romain Dillet
item.description:
AstroPay has been around since 2009. The bootstrapped company currently has 320 employees and is profitable. And yet, it’s not a name that comes up often in startup news. The company originally started its life as a payment service provider focused on Latin America — an alternative payment method that you would find next to the […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Focused Energy buys two of the world’s most powerful lasers for its fusion quest
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
The massive lasers will be installed in the startup’s future facility, which it is building in the San Francisco Bay Area.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Texas medical school says hackers stole sensitive health data of 1.4 million individuals
item.dc:creator: Carly Page
item.description:
The university's incident website blocks search engines from listing the site, making it more difficult for affected individuals to find the website in search results.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Meta fined $263M over 2018 security breach that affected ~3M EU users
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
Meta has been fined €251 million (around $263 million) in the European Union for a Facebook security breach that affected millions of users, which the company disclosed back in September 2018. The penalty, issued on Tuesday by Ireland’s Data Protection Commission (DPC) enforcing the bloc’s General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), is far from being the […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Nuon helps companies deploy their software into their customers’ cloud accounts
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
Jon Morehouse launched PowerTools in 2019 to help companies ship static sites and serverless apps to their cloud accounts on providers like AWS and Azure. When a customer asked him if they could use PowerTools to deploy their software into one of their customer’s cloud accounts, Morehouse was skeptical. Morehouse told TechCrunch that after that […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Pineapple on pizza is delicious — and if you disagree, you can’t log in to WordPress.org
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
There are few matters in life that divide a room more than the prudence of putting pineapple on pizza. But if you’re of the persuasion that tropical fruit has no place on a pie, you’ll have to swallow a bitter pill — if you want to access the WordPress.org developer portal and forum, at least. […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Remote enables USDC crypto payouts for contractors
item.dc:creator: Romain Dillet
item.description:
Getting paid in cryptocurrencies may sound like a bad idea, but this could be an actually useful feature for international contractors. Remote, the company that lets you hire people and manage contractors all around the world, is introducing crypto payouts on Tuesday. Companies based in the U.S. can start paying their contractors with stablecoins in […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: EU to investigate TikTok’s response to election security risks in Romania
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
TikTok is now subject to not one, but two Digital Services Act (DSA) investigations. The European Union announced on Tuesday that it has opened a formal proceeding focused on election risks, specifically in the context of recent elections in Romania. The probe will focus on TikTok’s recommender systems, principally “risks linked to the coordinated inauthentic manipulation […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: As account-to-account payments startups falter, Volume raises fresh cash
item.dc:creator: Mike Butcher
item.description:
Online merchants usually pay up to 8% of every sale to companies like PayPal, Apple Pay, and Stripe, and pass those costs on to consumers. So-called ‘account-to-account’ or ‘A2A’ payments can cut transaction fees to below 1%, saving merchants and consumers quite a bit of cash. The difficulty has been in making it seamless for both […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Travel is back: Hostaway raises $365M at $925M valuation
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
The tourism and travel industries are finally back on track, expected to make a “full recovery” to pre-pandemic levels of activity, the UN said earlier this month. As an indicator of that, Hostaway, one of the bigger software startups in the space, is announcing a giant round of funding to double down on growth.  The […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Meta to set up $50M privacy payment scheme to settle Australian proceeding
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
Meta has agreed to a $50 million payment program to settle a long-running proceeding in Australia related to misuse of information for political ad targeting, the country’s information watchdog OAIC announced Tuesday. The settlement concerns the 2018 Cambridge Analytica scandal, when data on millions of Facebook users was exfiltrated without their knowledge or consent by […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Kakao Mobility hit with $10.5M antitrust fine for limiting rivals’ access
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description:
South Korea’s antitrust watchdog has fined Kakao Mobility, the ride-hailing unit of Korean tech firm Kakao, $10.5 million (KRW 15.1 billion) for limiting competitors’ access to its taxi app — lowering the penalty from an initial fine of $50.3 million (KRW 72.4 billion) as the earlier sanction was based on an overestimated calculation of the […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Agave, the startup behind Find the Cat, finds $18M
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
A startup out of Turkey that has built a hit casual mobile game where you have to find cats in Where’s Wally-style drawings of increasing complexity has now found something else: $18 million in funding. Agave Games, the creator of Find the Cat, will be using the Series A to build out its team and […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Alphabet-backed Indian lender files for $171M IPO
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Aye Finance, a lender targeting small- and medium-sized businesses in India, is seeking to raise $171 million from its initial public offering, it disclosed in a filing Tuesday. The offering comprises a $104 million fresh share issue and a $67 million secondary sale by existing investors. Proceeds from the IPO will be used to expand […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: African digital bank Tyme raises $250M round led by Nubank at $1.5B valuation
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description:
Tyme Group, a South African fintech, has secured $250 million in a Series D round, pushing its valuation to $1.5 billion. The funding was led by Nu Holdings, which owns Latin America’s most valuable fintech NuBank, investing $150 million for a 10% stake. M&G Catalyst Fund invested $50 million, while existing shareholders provided the remaining […]
